intro: Osbeckia chulesis, commonly known as the Andean willow. It is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, clustered in racemes, and bloom during the warmer months. Osbeckia chulesis is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
